verses.roman:
na mayodita-pūrvaṁ vā
anṛtaṁ tad ime viduḥ
ekaikaśaḥ pratīcchadhvaṁ
sahaiveti su-madhyamāḥ

synonyms: na—never; mayā—by Me; udita—spoken; pūrvam—previously; vai—definitely; anṛtam—anything false; tat—that; ime—these young boys; viduḥ—know; eka-ekaśaḥ—one by one; pratīcchadhvam—pick out (your garments); saha—or all together; eva—indeed; iti—thus; su-madhyamāḥ—O slender-waisted girls.
translation: I have never before spoken a lie, and these boys know it. Therefore, O slender-waisted girls, please come forward, either one by one or all together, and pick out your clothes.
